data.title: Never Give Up with Sandy Martinez by Industry Talk with Connie Rotella
data.meta_description:
Martinez Creative Management Talent Agency
Fondée en 2001, MCM est une agence de gérance où nous nous associons à nos artistes à plusieurs niveaux. Nous mettons toutes les chances de nôtre côté en mariant leurs multiples talents respectifs et en apportant à leur carrière une vision claire, une ligne directrice ainsi qu'une gestion de leur image qui reflète leur personnalité, leur passion et leur buts.
​Nous sommes très actifs et créatifs non seulement dans notre façon de choisir des rôles qui seront marquants pour leur carrière mais aussi en créant avec eux des projets qui leur ressemblent.
data.text:
Katrine started in post-production 25 years ago and then moved to an agency where she first worked as an assistant but quickly became a junior agent. Under the guidance of her mentor, she started building her own roster and continued learning the quirks of the industry and then, almost 18 years ago, she opened her own company. Having studied in production, dabbled in radio and then worked in animation, dubbing and other spheres of post-production – becoming an agent seemed like the perfect way to unite all those realities. And she wanted to do it in both languages!

Guiding actors to craft their career path, to learn the business of acting and to present their best self is all part of what she loves.

She truly feels that this career chose her as much as she chose it !

Nicole Raviv is an international musical artist. A trilingual singer, songwriter and actress, she has performed globally in English, French, Hebrew, and Arabic. Raviv was born in Montreal, Canada to a Romanian mother and Moroccan father who immigrated from Israel. Raised in a multicultural household, she began training at McGill University's conservatory of music. Raviv moved to New York City, where she studied at The American Musical and Dramatic Academy (AMDA) and graduated with a Bachelor in Fine Arts (BFA) from The New School University in Musical Theatre. Nicole works with Grammy-award winning musicians and producers from around the world. Her current success has been attributed to her viral rendition of the National Anthem during 2021 Stanley Cup Playoffs for the New York Islanders hockey team. She is also a guest singer for major New York Sports (NHL, NBA, NFL, MLS) at Barclays Center, Metlife Stadium, Redbull Arena, Nassau Coliseum and UBS Arena. After making Aliyah to Israel, Raviv has incorporated original world music representing the discovery journey she is on; blending traditional Middle Eastern roots with the Western modern world creating a universal message of peace and cultural unity.

Stephanie’s favorite Intimacy Coordinating credits include : the tv series The Recruit (Netflix) and 3Pines (Amazon), the movie Disappointment BLVD (Dir:Ari Aster) , Lignes de Fuite (Réal: Myriam Bouchard/Catherine Chabot) and Les Liaisons Dangereuses (Theatre Français de Toronto). Since 2018, she’s put in over 100 hours of training as an Intimacy Professional. For the stage with various teachers at IDC (Intimacy Directors and Coordinators) and since 2021 with ICC (Intimacy Coordinators Canada). She is a bilingual actor (ACTRA/UDA/CAEA member) that has been working for over 20 years in countless productions: on screen, in theatre and in video games . She’s directed over a dozen theatre productions, both in French and English, has experience as a dramaturg and as co-artistic director of a festival of short plays. She was also a figure skating coach and choreographer for almost 20 years and teaching Intimacy for the stage and screen is really a passion of hers.

Originally from Trois-Rivières, Isabelle Giroux is an alumni of the music program at Cégep de Drummondville, in Quebec, where she studied with renowned singer Johanne Blouin. She also graduated from The American Musical and Dramatic Academy in Los Angeles, where she studied Musical Theatre and Cinema, as well as perfected her American accent.

Isabelle can't get enough of the show business. She's got energy and more than one trick in her bag. You will get to see more of her, either in movies, on tv, on stage, in short film festivals, in commercials, and even behind the camera.

Always a dreamer, Nir began his career in the spotlight as a young boy making impersonations and skits in front of his family during the holidays and reunions, with aspirations of being on the big screen and on stage in front of large audiences.

With appearances on NBC's hit hospital drama "Transplant", Nickelodeon's "Snow Day", "Misanthrope" starring Shailene Woodley & Ben Mendelsohn, Bravo’s “19-2” and the CBC’s “This Life”, along with numerous independent productions, Nir has come a long way since his memorable holiday performances in his living room as a child.

​Over the past 14 years, Nir has been a part of numerous plays with Brave New Productions, from one of his most challenging roles (Aaron McKinney) in the Laramie Project: 10 years later, to Yazmina Reza’s ART, to the META nominated Ensemble cast of 33 Variations by Moises Kaufman. He has also helped direct and produce several of BNP’s productions (Mistakes Were Made, Sylvia, and the upcoming Vanya and Sonya and Masha and Spike), as well as an 8 episode webseries called "This is Gus", which he self-produced, wrote, edited and acted in.

Nir also founded “Nearly Funny”, an online Sketch comedy show that can be viewed on most Social Media platforms, with a mission to make people laugh and provide Montreal actors with a creative space/community to perform and tell some fun stories. With over 500 sketches and 200K followers, across all platforms, there is "nearly" enough funny to go around!

With a strong belief in hard work and training, he continues to develop and hone his craft by attending workshops, learning new techniques and continuously performing, whenever and wherever he can.

Follow your Bliss. What turns you on. What makes you and your body feel alive and empowered! Start noticing what and who sucks that from you in your life. Is it too many screens? People who don’t encourage and truly unconditionally support you….. Notice. Become aware and make a new choice.

Like nature, we, our bodies, the industry, life, is ALWAYS changing. So nothing, not even the slow times or hard times will stay the same, they are sure to change, just as the seasons do. So in the meantime, why not make choices that uplift and empower you?

Two quotes from two beloved acting coaches: Warren Robertson used to say," if it ain’t fun….RUN!” and a coach from Women In The Director’s chair at the Banff School Of Fine Art’s, I hold dear every day: "There will always be a role with your name on it.”

"So, why not be you? Everyone else is taken" from Oscar Wilde.

Felicia is passionate about moving and telling stories; that started at the ripe old age of three when she saw her first play and became hooked. By the age of six she began studying and performing on stage. Born and raised in Montreal with the spirit of a gypsy, she left her home at seventeen and has studied, traveled, lived and worked all over Canada, the U.S., the Middle East, the Caribbean and Europe. Felicia's mom wanted her to be a lawyer. Felicia's dad wanted her to be a nightclub singer. Felicia's passion for the arts won out. She left her pre-law studies part way through university and never looked back. Despite her appetite for travel and adventure, Felicia surprised herself by returning to her hometown in 2000; where she now enjoys performing in English and French in film, television, and her first love, theatre and musical theatre. She also lends her voice to countless T.V. and radio adds, narration, video games and cartoons. When Felicia's not moving people with her performances she moves them with her body, as a certified personal trainer, aqua fit, aqua yoga, yoga, Nia black belt and groove facilitator.

Daniel Murphy is a Canadian actor and singer-songwriter. As an experienced triple-threat with a passion for storytelling, Daniel has been sharing his remarkable talent with the Canadian entertainment industry for over 20 years. Daniel began his career at the Stratford Festival in the productions of “West Side Story” and “Dracula”, and later played Gilbert Blythe in the production of “Anne of Green Gables” at the Charlottetown Festival. He went on to perform in the stage run of “Chicago” in both Montréal and Paris, performing alongside the rest of the cast at the Cesar’s award ceremony in France. As a screen actor, Daniel has been involved in many large-scale projects for film and television, including “The Ninth” on CBC Gem and television programs and movies like “Heritage Minute Canada” and “Prescription for Danger”. He recently appeared in “Toute Les Deux”, an LGBTQ+-focused film that screened at the Tampa International Gay and Lesbian Film Festival in 2021. In 2022, Daniel joined the cast of the highly-anticipated Amazon Prime series, “Three Pines”, Incendo’s “The Christmas Checklist” Parts 1 &2, and starred in the Segal Centre’s production of “April Fools”. To learn more about Daniel, click here.

SOCIAL LINKS:

Instagram: @danielmurphyartist

Twitter: @michaelmurphymu

Facebook: @Daniel Murphy

Daughter of Canadian soprano Nicole Lorange and Spanish sculptor Kieff Grediaga, Elyzabeth discovers her passion for the stage at a very young age. Indeed, singing, dancing, acting and traveling around the world are part of her day-to-day life. This lifestyle draws a very unusual path for her…

Despite a classical music influence at home, it is her rebellious side that will push Elyzabeth towards rock music when she sees Pat Benatar’s first video on MTV during a trip to New York where mother was singing at the Metropolitan Opera. She later discovers that she has this in common with the singer as she, also, had a singer mom. This style allows her a greater freedom of expression and after playing in a student musical when she was 17, participating in various cover bands at age 18, she starts her quest to conquer the large Quebec bar scene with her own band Dizzy Miss Lizzy, singing the best rock & top 40 hits.

In 2010, she envisions the creation of her own ONE WOMAN SHOW to pay tribute to the great female icons who revolutionized the world of rock of the last four decades and it is in 2012 that the QoR adventure begins with the collaboration of two important sponsors Claude de Grandpré of the THC & Mario Gauthier of Media Musique.

In 2013, Queens of Rock comes to life on the stage of The Hector-Charland Theater in L’Assomption, Quebec in front of a full house. The Canadian promotional video was actually filmed during this premiere.

In 2014, after attending one of the shows, Mister Gilles Beaulieu of Chrysalide Productions joins the QoR team as co-producer and promoter of the show and already envisions the exportation of Queens of Rock to Las Vegas.

In 2020, Elyzabeth takes the stage of La Voix 8 and impresses the coaches while driving the crowd wild as she interprets her electifying rendition of Heart's Crazy on You.

QUEENS OF ROCK is presently holding a residency at THE MOSAIC ON THE STRIP IN LAS VEGAS.

Nathalie Bonin is a composer and violinist from Montreal, Canada now based in Los Angeles.

Composer and Solo Violinist for the Grammy Winning “Women Warriors: The Voices of Change” soundtrack, her most recent album “Queen of Hearts” received multiple accolades including a Nomination from the Music+Sound Award for “Best Use of Production Music in a TV Trailer”, the HMMA Award for “Instrumental” category for her piece “Euphoria”and the Mark Award for “Classical Track of the Year” with “Arrival of the Princess” that was featured on Netflix “Bridgerton” season 2 Finale. Nathalie has scored the music for numerous movies, short films, and television series as well as theme songs and soundtracks for worldwide audiences including NBC “New Amsterdam”, CBS “Good Sam” (trailer), AppleTV+ “The Oprah Conversations”, Hallmark, Showtime, and numerous other networks.

Concertmaster of La Voix TVA (The Voice) in Montreal for 8 years, she has been a featured violinist with Wynton Marsalis, Ted Nash and the Jazz at Lincoln Center Orchestra as well as performed or recorded with: Stevie Wonder, Luciano Pavarotti, Chance The Rapper, YES, Cirque du Soleil, DeadMau5, Alan Parsons, Peter Cetera, Charles Aznavour, Gino Vannelli, Moist and Bran Van 3000. She recently premiered 2 violin concertos by Quinsin Nachoff and Jairo Duarte-Lopez.

Nathalie holds dual citizenship (USA/CANADA) and is Founder and Owner of Kinémuse Productions inc. in Montréal, Canada since 2015.

In this episode, we're joined by Travis Cormier! Travis shares with us his step-by-step journey on how he turned his passion into an international career. A dream that turned into reality!

He discovered the secret and followed his heart which led him to meet the right industry artists who inspired him to become the artist he is now.

Travis released his first album Dollars & Hearts in 2018. Produced by Bob Rock (Metallica, Mötley Crüe, Bon Jovi) and recorded at the Warehouse Studio in Vancouver, the album reached over 400,000 streams on Spotify. That same year, Travis had another career milestone when he opened for Bon Jovi at a sold-out concert at the Bell Centre in Montreal.

In November 2021, Travis released "Where's Time Gone"; a 5-song mini-album.

Travis is currently playing the leading role of Strat in the Las Vegas production of Jim Steinman's Bat Out of Hell The Musical!

Tap Dancer. Performer. Choreographer. Speaker. Believer. Montreal native Travis Knights is realizing his dreams, pounding rhythms on wood floors all over the world. His talent and dedication have earned him audiences in Shanghai, Dusseldorf, Paris, New York, and Vancouver to name a few.

His career started in 2000, when he was cast as a principal dancer in the motion picture biography of Bill 'Bojangles' Robinson with Gregory Hines and Savion Glover. The film, entitled 'Bojangles' was choreographed by the legendary Henry LeTang.

In 2006, he was tapped to be the principal dancer in the video game adaptation of Warner Brother's 'Happy Feet'. In 2007 and 2008, Travis participated extensively as a Tap Dance consultant for Cirque du Soleil. Since then, he has performed in Tandem Act Productions' 'Diary of a Tap Dancer' at the Apollo Theatre, and the touring show 'Wonderland: A Tap Tribute to Stevie Wonder', created by Ayodele Casel and Sarah Savelli.

He was a featured Tap Dancer in the Opening Ceremonies to the 2010 Winter Olympic Games in Vancouver. In the same year he toured North America with the raucous and rowdy internationally acclaimed Australian Tap Dance show, Tap Dogs.

From 2010 to 2013, Travis jumped into the dance company world as a principal dancer with Tapestry Dance Company in Austin, Texas. During his time there he was awarded the Austin Critic's Table Award for best dance artist in 2011 and 2013. In 2014, he embarked on a self-produced world tour, filming his web series entitled ’The Interviews' featuring celebrated pioneers in the tap dance world. He recently debuted new works in Thomas Marek's show NOLA in Hamburg, Germany.

He currently lives in Brampton, Ontario and hosts a weekly podcast (The Tap Love Tour Podcast, subscribe and download on itunes) featuring interviews of a myriad of inspiring artists. Travis is currently developing an original full length work commissioned by Soulpepper as a part of Project Imagination, Canada’s largest theatre commissioning project of new work by Canadian artists. Look out for him, because the best is yet to come.

On this episode, we're joined by Jeff Dimitriou. Megahouse Industry choreographer, director, and artist Jeff Dimitriou, is renowned for the energy and passion he instills within and around artistic projects that include Film, Television, World Ceremonies, Theatre, Live events, and Art Installations.

Jeff is co-creator of 4 original shows currently being rehearsed with Creativiva, for Sandals Beaches Resort in the Turks & Caico’s, as well as a JDX original creation titled “SOZO”, which premiered at the Hillside Beach Club in Turkey for a 3 year permanent residency, with a world tour in the the development stages. Jeff also choreographed the World & Canadian National Tour of Return to Grace, and is also the stage director and choreographer on the North American touring show The 60’s Experience.

Recently, Jeff had a busy fall, Choreographing the new film version of Anne of Green Gables, choreography that was featured on the Netflix hit Degrassi, choreographer of Footloose and Mamma Mia, a national art installation campaign for BMO & Cineplex, A Middle Eastern Tour of the stage musical Cinderella, and also choreographed the Opening Piece for the 2016 Cultural Architect Awards.

Jeff’s film & Television work includes: The L.A. Complex (CW Network), Come Dance With Me (Hallmark/CTV), Warehouse 13 (Syfy Network), Carrie, Hallmark hit ‘Cowboy for Christmas, Emmy Award winning Odd Squad, Lucky Seven, Hemlock Grove, and has been the resident choreographer for Degrassi (Netflix) for over 8 seasons and 25 episodes.

Other choreography credits include: Associate Choreographer on the CW’s: Hellcats, Sucker Punch (Warner Bros), So You Think You Can Dance Canada, Twilight: Breaking Dawn Saga, Human Target, and Girl Walks Into a Bar. Jeff was also part of the choreography team which worked on the feature film Mirror, Mirror starring Oscar Winner - Julia Roberts and Tony Winner - Nathan Lane, Imaginary Mary, and The Magicians.

Born in a small fishing village in Gaspe, Quebec, then raised in Iqaluit, N.W.T, Nathalie Yves Gaulthier spent most of her childhood a blonde-green eyed minority raised amongst Inuits/(Eskimos). By age 10, she was fluent in her native French, Inuit, then English.

She wrote her first play at age 7 “Blue Christmas”, and was featured on CBC radio as a young upcoming writer and director. From ages 10 to her 20s, Nathalie was a known face in the Quebec Television world, appearing as a regular on numerous TV series and singing on children’s records. She had several lead roles in English films and guest stared on numerous US television series. During this time, she was also a competitive gymnast, studied aerial/circus arts and won national Public speaking contests across Canada, in her third language!

Nathalie began her first kids' talent agency when she herself was just a kid at 15 years old. Her clients went on to be Emmy and Oscar nominated actors and film makers, to international humanitarians and dance school owners like herself. Her years of working with kids, pushing them hard, believing in them, yet demanding their absolute best at all times was the key to help them achieve their dreams

She moved to Los Angeles in 1997 as the first Canadian agent to ever open offices in the US while simultaneously operating Canadian offices as well. She launched numerous young stars in Hollywood shortly thereafter and has been known as “the kid it girl” in the entertainment industry ever since.

In recent years, Nat has been making a difference with her inspirational children's programs. She opened Le Studio LA in 2010 with a vision to inspire youths and utilize their gifts to make the world a better place. The professional team, Le Petit CiRqUe®, is the world's only all-kid humanitarian cirque company and has mesmerized numerous audiences worldwide with their talents. Nat believes in fostering programs for today's youth in order to give them a supportive environment in which to thrive and be themselves, while spreading the message of love, kindness and understanding.

Today, we're joined by Adam Reid; Award-Winning Fluently Bilingual Master Of Ceremonies, Producer and Actor Of Change. Adam has hosted hundreds of events, shows, and galas for brands across North America. His passion for personal growth, alongside his life achievements, has positioned him as an impactful keynote speaker. His talk “REIDFrame Your Mind. REIDFrame your Life” will leave audiences feeling empowered to see the world through clearer lenses. The goal? To equip you with the tools to identify where change is needed in your daily life and how to take action today.

Adam was also the head of production of original content at Goalcast, the leaders in online empowerment empowering people worldwide to “LIVE THE IMPOSSIBLE” Adam is a mentor, and public speaking coach for executives and their teams, nonprofit leaders and rising stars. He’s an author, mental health advocate, proud father of three and self-made actor of change. Committed to reframing the lives of those around him for the better.

The ground-breaking Docu-Series, hosted by sisters Aiza and Kamana Ntibarikure. The Show explores the voices of Black Women and non-binary Black people.

Aiza and Kamana are always ready to spill the tea or share a little behind-the-scenes anecdote about their personal lives. Likewise, as two natural performers with remarkable synergy, they are always ready to break into a song or skit to punctuate their stories. Real Blackity Talk is a love letter to Black Canadians. "We’re not being fully represented on screen, so we decided to create a series that we’ve always longed to see: An unapologetically funny show full of amazing Black people and compelling stories.” says creators and hosts Aiza and Kamana Ntibarikure. “Expect to laugh. Expect to learn a lil’ something. Expect to feel empowered." Ultimately, Real Blackity Talk is a necessary addition to the Canadian media landscape, not just for the Black community, but for anyone looking for fresh new voices and faces to cover topics that are universal to all of us.

Artist, singer and songwriter Barnev Valsaint joins us this week on Industry Talk sharing his journey from his number one hit song with the hip hop group Dubmatique on their hit ''Soul Pleureur''. The success of this song is historical because it launched Quebec's hip hop! Barnev has also been working and touring with the legendary Celine Dion for the past 20 years. Now he is getting ready to launch his first solo album this summer.

The stars were always aligned for Barnev. He shares with us his story on the process and journey that brought him to many different places around the world. He is so grateful for all the connections and opportunities. His love for music is unstoppable!

This is a great episode for every songwriter and artist writing and producing their own music!

Albert Chambers has been on the cutting edge of creating amazing works of art working alongside David Usher, Corey Hart, Dream Theatre, Debbie Gibson, Simple Plan and many others. In 2013 Chambers was nominated for a Juno award and a Felix award for Best Adult Contemporary Album of the Year, for his work on Coral Egan’s “The Year He Drove Me Crazy”. Chambers went on to become an Official Juno Jury Member between 2015-2017. Chambers is credited as a contributing columnist for Canadian Music Magazine, Professional Sound Magazine and Muzik ETC magazine. As well as being an amazing music composer and producer Chambers is also a highly talented videographer and has incredible skills in both music and video post-production.

Go get your greatness with Entrepreneur, Director and Consultant Connie Rotella!

Get to know our program director more with this interview created by Breaking the Curtain, two academy artists that took action and created a theatre podcast that has reached over 14K listeners around the world.

Connie is always open to sharing her story on the 'HOW TO GET IT DONE.' When you show up to your life and dreams then passion leads the way to your own greatness and doors open without you having to wait for someone to do it for you. You're in flow with what you love to do and then you attract from that space. You allow yourself to become the person you envision to be.
